page.title: 01SUMMARY OF OUR BLOCK,TELFORD
page.content: {TELFORD,}Shropshire's new town is 12 miles from Shrewsbury, 35 from Birmingham & 19 from Wolverhampton. The town is named after{THOMAS TELFORD who was Shropshire's first County Surveyor & engineer. It was originally designated{Dawley New Town in 1963}to relieve the overcrowded industrial West Midlands. It was planned for an area extending South from{the A5 to {the Severn Gorge. In 1968}the area was enlarged to include{Wellington,Trench, {Admaston,Oakengates,Donnington & {Hadley.}The new area was renamed {Telford New Town.}Our block covers the centre of Telford.It includes{the Town {Centre shopping complex,the Town Park, {the Ice Rink,part of Stafford Park {Industrial Estate,the Fitness & {Racquet Centre & Stirchley Grange. There are 9 housing developments: some old, some new,some a mixture of both.
